Comment: It‚Äôs not Constitutional.   The US Constitution can be amended through a process outlined in Article V, involving both Congress and state legislatures. An amendment can be proposed by either a two-thirds vote in both houses of Congress, or by a convention called for by two-thirds of the state legislatures. Once proposed, it requires ratification by three-fourths of the states, either through their legislatures or conventions.   How is this EVER going to happen? It WON‚ÄôT ever happen.
